wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Bradshaw ((1920-10-11)11 October 1920 – December 20, 1981(1981-12-20) (aged 61)) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, England and Lancashire, and at club level for Wigan (Heritage № 418), Leigh and Workington Town, plus a one-off WW2 guest appearance for St Helens (Heritage № 590) and Oldham RLFC (Heritage № 369), as a scrum-half, i.e. number 7.
